description: An introduction to the history, concepts, and methods of the anthropological study of ancient peoples using archaeological illustrations to indicate the relationships of archaeological interpretations with cultural and physical anthropology.
name: INTRO TO ARCHAEOLOGY

values.comments:
This course is an introduction to the history, concepts, and methods of the anthropological study of ancient peoples. It uses archaeological illustrations to indicate the relationships of archaeological interpretations with cultural and physical anthropology.

Students mostly agreed that this course was “interesting” and “manageable.” Many commented that the “material improved after a few weeks,” and by the end there was a general sense of “satisfaction.” Several students felt the material was occasionally “dry” or “boring.”

Students overall commented that Professor Olszewski was “passionate” and “engaging.” One student wrote that Professor Olszewski’s “enthusiasm for the material is contagious even to those who never considered a career in archeology.”

Some students felt the readings were occasionally “heavy,” but most agreed that the work and grading was “fair.” The course was not considered particularly challenging and would be appropriate for anyone interested in the subject. This course fulfills the History and Tradition sector requirement and has no prerequisites.
